before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"2bu0l","text":"Plan your experiment carefully. Ensure appropriate safety of all researchers throughout the work. Ensure welfare of the invertebrates used is appropriately considered. For the reduction of sample cross-contamination, consider using separate pre- and post-PCR work spaces and use bleach/Chemgene and/or UV decontamination of surfaces and equipment throughout.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"f0ofb","text":"This protocol describes the workflow used for the gut content analysis via DNA metabarcoding of scorpions and spiders for some work conducted in the Hebrew University of Jerusalem, Israel. The protocol describes sample processing, DNA extraction, PCR amplification, gel electrophoresis, DNA normalisation, PCR-based library preparation, DNA purification and (briefly) sequencing and bioinformatics.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"3g0g7","text":"The welfare of invertebrates, although poorly regulated, is of crucial importance when collecting and analysing them. Limiting suffering, but also taking only what is necessary is key. See the below citations for some considerations for this.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36qtn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahdda","text":"Crump A, Gibbons M, Barrett M, Birch J, Chittka L (2023) Is it time for insect researchers to consider their subjects’ welfare? steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6q39","text":"Collect arachnids from study sites, place them into   ethanol and store them at   until ready to proceed with DNA extraction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":52,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":80,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1on4o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3miu9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3qa4i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"100","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":14}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ct03c","text":"Consider the experimental design carefully to ensure that there is sufficient replication of the taxa sampled to answer the research questions. Consider the welfare and conservation of the invertebrate individuals and populations throughout this process too.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6s1kc","text":"Decide how samples will be distributed across plates (but don't distribute DNA yet). Consider including a negative control in each row and column to detect any contaminants in each tagged forward and reverse primer. Among these wells, include any DNA extraction negative controls. Include positive controls (ideally mixed samples of species not found in the same study system), perhaps one adjacent to negative controls and the other adjacent only to samples (but both on separate rows and columns). Include blank controls (ideally wells into which no reagents or at least no primers are added), perhaps one adjacent to negative controls and the other adjacent only to samples (but both on separate rows and columns).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qp26","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2q730","text":"If using multiple PCR primer pairs, familiarise yourself with the annealing temperatures for each and prepare separate PCR plates for each. {"blocks":[{"key":"e5rfq","text":"Prepare a gel tank containing sufficient 1X TBE buffer to submerge the gel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3k6dn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"atujp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ehc5t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"edq0b","text":"TBE buffer can be purchased pre-made or made from its constituent reagents. Alternative buffers like borax can, however, be cheaper, easier and quicker to use.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"alqdl","text":"If the PCRs were replicated (i.e., each sample run multiple times for each PCR primer pair used), these can be merged together into one plate per PCR primer pair at this point, or carried forward separately. Keeping the replicates separate increases the number of libraries to prepare and sequence later, but better facilitates identification of inconsistencies between samples. To merge triplicates, assuming use of   reaction volumes, pipette   from each well of two of the three plates into the corresponding well of the third. Briefly centrifuge the merged plate to move the oil to the top of the product again.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":417,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":445,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b18db","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jg50","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2fse8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"df9ps","text":"To avoid pipetting oil from the oil-sealed PCR products, plunge the pipette to the first stop and fully insert the pipette tip into the bottom of the well, then release sharply. The PCR product will be taken up quickly, whereas the relatively viscous oil will be taken up slowly, thus being outcompeted by the PCR product and mostly left behind.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2r2cg","text":"Quantify the concentration of the library from the previous step (e.g., using Qubit dsDNA assay).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ej7f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hgat","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e3bsn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bf2ef","text":"At this point, many sequencing facilities will accept the samples and can carry out the subsequent steps themselves. This may be preferable if the appropriate library preparation/indexing primers are not available. Below, the process for PCR-based library preparation will be detailed as an example.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b69g7","text":"Check with your sequencing provider how many fmol they will need in how many µL. This will be based on the sequencer, sequencing cartridge and any QC processes they follow. The libraries should be ready for sequencing. Sequencing times will depend on the machines, protocols and any queues involved at the sequencing facility.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d1qjr","text":"Depending on the arachnid, the optimal manner of extracting gut contents can differ. Here, we present two subtly different methods for scorpion and spider gut content analysis. These will be more broadly applicable to other arachnids (e.g., pseudoscorpions, mites, solifugids) but also many other invertebrates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ff90v","text":"Add     ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":6,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dlp9o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"400","error":false,"guid":"C950F816936011EE959A0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"400","concentration":"80","error":false,"error_concentration":false,"guid":"C950F884936011EE959A0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":14}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"10skn","text":"Remove the ethanol and add a further     ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":37,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":39,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"24dgc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"400","error":false,"guid":"C950F3E1936011EE959A0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"400","concentration":"80","error":false,"error_concentration":false,"guid":"C950F475936011EE959A0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":14}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9rg50","text":"Remove the ethanol completely. Briefly centrifuge the sample to collect and remove any residual ethanol. Allow to air-dry until the aggregation of magnetic beads transitions from 'glossy' (shiny reflection of light) to 'matte' (dull dark brown mass), but not so long that it dries completely (i.e., begins to turn a rusty red and shows cracks).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2929k","text":"Add   molecular grade water and mix by vortexing. Incubate at   for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":62,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":68,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1cedq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"CF2020BF936011EE959A0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"CF202144936011EE959A0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","duration":300,"error":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"CF2021E7936011EE959A0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6rr6t","text":"Place the sample on a magnetic stand for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":41,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ed4dr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"CF202425936011EE959A0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"51m98","text":"Remove   of the water and place it in a new tube. This will be the library used in the subsequent section.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":7,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c9stj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"95","error":false,"guid":"CF202612936011EE959A0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2r2cg","text":"Quantify the concentration of the library from the previous step (e.g., using Qubit dsDNA assay).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ej7f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hgat","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e3bsn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bf2ef","text":"At this point, many sequencing facilities will accept the samples and can carry out the subsequent steps themselves. This may be preferable if the appropriate library preparation/indexing primers are not available. Below, the process for PCR-based library preparation will be detailed as an example.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fnib3","text":"Dilute library to ≤  (≤5 ng/µL) in molecular grade water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":19,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4ddio","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ff6f1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7l2nj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"5000","error_concentration":false,"guid":"ED3C8A53936011EE959A0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":205}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fvltr","text":"Without diluting the library, there is a risk that the adapters will not be added to all DNA (i.e., there is too much DNA) which will compromise the sequencing yield.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5hah1","text":"Add a drop of mineral oil to one PCR tube for each library, alongside an additional tube for a negative control.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4rpvd","text":"Per library, assemble the following reaction:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ejgus","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bu3k9","text":"   AB1ReagentVolume22X hot-start PCR mastermix7.53Molecular grade water14Nextera sequencing adapter primer mix1.55DNA library5","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":126}],"data":{}},{"key":"7efp2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctinl","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","0_2":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","1_2":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","2_2":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","3_2":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","4_2":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","5_2":"","A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":[100,100],"data":[["Reagent","Volume"],["2X hot-start PCR mastermix","7.5"],["Molecular grade water","1"],["Nextera sequencing adapter primer mix","1.5"],["DNA library","5"]],"guid":"13C6F6A392624A2EB8D50ACBA33EE942","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reagent","Volume"],["2X hot-start PCR mastermix","7.5"],["Molecular grade water","1"],["Nextera sequencing adapter primer mix","1.5"],["DNA library","5"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"77puo","text":"Briefly centrifuge the tubes to ensure that the oil is above the PCR mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"34otl","text":"Load the PCR reactions into a thermocycler. Ensure that the temperature regime matches the enzyme used (including any heat activation for hot-start Taq) and that the annealing temperature matches the PCR primers used. Run for 12 cycles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2ov3","text":"Quantify the concentration of the library from the previous step (e.g., using Qubit dsDNA assay).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fu8g","text":"Check that the adapters have been added to the DNA by determining and comparing the amplicon sizes for libraries before and after this second PCR. Amplicons should be longer after the second PCR. This is ideally assessed using a digital system like TapeStation, but even gel electrophoresis will work.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6f7e7","text":"Once successful adapter addition is confirmed, libraries can be pooled so that each is equimolar in the final mixture based on the concentrations determined above (e.g., by Qubit).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ku7j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"49lou","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f8csq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cql9m","text":"This can be achieved by dividing the maximum concentration across the libraries by each library concentration and pooling that many µL from each. These values may need to be multiplied up to ensure adequate yield for sequencing.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cdbct","text":"\n","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"31ift","text":"Be careful if using multiple PCR primer pairs! Different amplicons have different molecular weights, so pool based on fmol rather than ng/µL.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b69g7","text":"Check with your sequencing provider how many fmol they will need in how many µL. This will be based on the sequencer, sequencing cartridge and any QC processes they follow. The libraries should be ready for sequencing. Sequencing times will depend on the machines, protocols and any queues involved at the sequencing facility.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"75pdt","text":"Optimal bioinformatics workflows depend on a variety of factors including target taxa, study system, the genetic marker used, computational resources available and various other factors. Other resources with code integration will be much better suited to detailing the steps involved. The process will likely follow a similar progression of steps though:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69gru","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmdhb","text":"Read processing: demultiplex, trim primers, merge pairs.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1am1a","text":"Filtering and error correction: quality filtering, dereplication, denoising, chimera filtering.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17qmi","text":"Taxonomic unit aggregation: OTU/ASV delimitation.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6q6ok","text":"Taxon assignment: reference database curation, taxon assignment.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
